data.title: Divide them into Teams
data.statement:
On the playground, there is a line of kids: [[allTheKids]]
Divide them into [[numOfTeams]] teams.

Example of how:
If [[numOfTeams]] is 3:
• 1st kid goes to Team 1
• 2nd kid goes to Team 2
• 3rd kid goes to Team 3
• 4th kid goes to Team 1
• 5th kid goes to Team 2
• 6th kid goes to Team 3
• 7th kid goes to Team 1
• etc, until all kids have been assigned to a team.

(Final teams might not all have the same number of kids.)

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
Lisa, Frank, Lucy, Ann, Helen, Fran
3
testCases.testOut:
Team 1: Lisa, Ann
Team 2: Frank, Helen
Team 3: Lucy, Fran

data.stubGenerator:
read allKids:string(1000)
read numOfTeams:int
write all the teams
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> string [[allTheKids]], separated with a comma and a space
<<Line 2:>> integer [[numOfTeams]]
data.outputDescription:
<<[[numOfTeams]] lines:>> {{Team [[teamNumber]]:}} [[kidsInThatTeam]]
• [[teamNumber]] ranges from {{1}} to [[numOfTeams]].
• The kids are separated with a comma and a space.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

On the playground, there is a line of kids: allTheKids
Divide them into numOfTeams teams.

Example of how:
If numOfTeams is 3:
• 1st kid goes to Team 1
• 2nd kid goes to Team 2
• 3rd kid goes to Team 3
• 4th kid goes to Team 1
• 5th kid goes to Team 2
• 6th kid goes to Team 3
• 7th kid goes to Team 1
• etc, until all kids have been assigned to a team.

(Final teams might not all have the same number of kids.)
Input
Line 1: string allTheKids, separated with a comma and a space
Line 2: integer numOfTeams
Output
numOfTeams lines: Team teamNumber: kidsInThatTeam
• teamNumber ranges from 1 to numOfTeams.
• The kids are separated with a comma and a space.
Constraints
Example
Input
Lisa, Frank, Lucy, Ann, Helen, Fran
3
Output
Team 1: Lisa, Ann
Team 2: Frank, Helen
Team 3: Lucy, Fran
